      • alphaLexeme

        public static Token alphaLexeme​(java.lang.String input,
                                int lexemeBegin,
                                java.lang.Integer lineNumber)
        Finds the alphanumeric(only identifiers or reserved keywords but not literals, punctuation or other operators) token in the given input
        Parameters:
        input - Input String
        lexemeBeginSt - starting index of the lexeme to be generated
        lineNumber - Line number in the source program
        Returns:
        token valid token in the input program

      • numericLexeme

        public static Token numericLexeme​(java.lang.String input,
                                  int lexemeBegin,
                                  java.lang.Integer lineNumber)
        Finds the numeric(only integers and floats) token in the given input
        Parameters:
        input - Input String
        lexemeBegin - Starting index of the lexeme to be generated
        lineNumber - Line number in the source program
        Returns:
        token valid token in the input program

      • nextToken

        public static java.util.List<Token> nextToken​(java.lang.Integer lineNumber,
                                              java.lang.String input)
        Iterates through the given input until n unless a valid token is found
        Parameters:
        lineNumber - Line number in the source program
        input - Input String
        Returns:
        list of valid tokens in the provided input

      • lexicalAnalyzer

        public static void lexicalAnalyzer​(java.lang.String inputPath)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        The main controller for lexical phase that calls the nextToken() function repeatedly to generate all the tokens for the given input. Once it hits the end of source program, it outputs all the tokens in the output file and encountered errors in the error file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - handles the I/O related interruptions
